translation.en: [female narrator] The ancient Greeks believed humans once had four arms,
translation.es: Los antiguos griegos creíanque los humanos tenían cuatro brazos,

translation.en: four legs, and a single head made of two faces.
translation.es: cuatro piernasy una sola cabeza con dos caras.

translation.en: fearing our wholeness would quell our need for worship, cleaved us in two...
translation.es: temiendo que necesitáramos alabanzas,nos dividieron en dos.

translation.en: leaving our split selves to wander the Earth in misery.
for the other half of our soul.
It is said that when one half finds its other...
translation.es: Dicen que, cuando una mitadencuentra a la otra...

translation.en: And each would know no greater joy...
translation.es: Y cada unano conocería alegría más grande...

translation.en: the ancient Greeks never went to high school.
translation.es: los antiguos griegosno iban a la secundaria.

translation.en: [narrator] ...we don't need the gods to mess things up for us.

translation.en: with new recipes. And-- And FYI, taco sausage is really effing good.

translation.en: Okay, but I'm the fourth son
and my family's been making the same sausage for 49 years
translation.es: Hace 49 años que mi familiahace la misma salchicha

translation.en: and it doesn't matter if they're going broke, or out of style,
translation.es: y no importa si quiebrano si no están de moda.

translation.en: they're Nana's recipes. If Ma can't have Nana, at least she can make her sausages.
translation.es: Son las recetas de la abuela.Mamá solo tiene eso de ella.

translation.en: If I break away, it'll break her heart. And it's either her heart or mine.
translation.es: Si me alejo, la destrozaré.Es su corazón o el mío.

translation.en: We had to go where my dad could get a job.
translation.es: Debimos ir a donde papá trabajara.

translation.en: So, uh,  he became the station manager at Squahamish.
translation.es: Entonces, fue el encargadode la estación de Squahamish.

translation.en: The plan was to be promoted to system engineer.
translation.es: El plan era ascendera ingeniero de sistemas.

translation.en: It turns out speaking good English trumps having a PhD.
translation.es: Resulta que hablar bien ingléssupera un doctorado.

translation.en: -He's not bad. -I don't speak very good either.
translation.es: - ¡No es malo!- Yo tampoco hablo muy bien.

translation.en: How do you feel about pot roast?
I should get back to the station. I know, but we've gotta eat.
translation.es: - Debo volver a la estación.- Hay que comer.
Tommy, no contactes a mis amigos.

translation.en: Would you like to weigh in or are you just gonna scream throughout the meal?

translation.en: I'll deal with the dog wrestling.
[Paul] Or we could go to your place?
translation.es: O podríamos ir a tu casa.

translation.en: Match energy, match strokes, and just say one thing.
translation.es: Combina energía y golpesy solo di una cosa.

translation.en: Okay. Good. That wasn't so hard.
It just seems like a really short conversation.

translation.en: I was born in Xuzhou, China.
[Mr. Flores] How does Satan get his message through?
Outside are the dogs, the sorcerers, the immoral persons. [groans]

translation.es: Satanás planta la semilla de la duda
y, de esa semilla, nace el pecado. EL PADRE STANLEY LO SABE TODO

translation.en: We're lucky to live in a good town like Squahamish.

translation.en: Let us stay strong against Satan's call,
translation.es: Estemos fuertesante el llamado de Satanás.

translation.en: You know what it's like to finally meet someone your age who gets you?

Cerdo estofado sobre arroz. ¿Y la tuya?

I'm always looking for new spices.
Giving up on the taco sausage?
Oh, no way. I've been writing to the paper in Wenatchee for months now.

What do the other Munskys think?
Taco sausage has a nice ring to it.
I bet she would've tried the taco sausage.

And she smells like fresh-ground flour.

How her eyes look right into yours.

busts out like she can't help herself and she stops being so perfect

How you could live in an ocean of her thoughts and...

- Quise decir...- No, soy un tonto.

And-- And you don't even care.
I mean, I love her and I can't even...

Okay, she gives you a look and, when you see the look, you make your move.

not just a friend date, when she gets back from some youth group in Sacramento.

You know, without the jeans and the flannel shirt...

but we never made it all the way to California.

I can be such a nervous idiot.

I mean, Paul would never think that about you, because he's way into you.

Twice. 6:40 a.m. and 11:40 p.m weekdays. 12:10 p.m. and 9:20 p.m weekends.

-♪ You think you know ♪ -To my favorite secret place.
